snippet: Robert Malley, who advised President Bill Clinton on Israeli-Palestinian talks, is returning to manage the fraying ties between the United States and its allies in the Persian Gulf.
abstract: Diplomatic Memo; Robert Malley, who advised Pres Bill Clinton on Israeli-Palestinian talks, returns to the White House; he will manage fraying ties between the United States and its allies in the Persian Gulf, job that says a lot about how America’s role in the Middle East has changed.
lead_paragraph: Robert Malley, who advised President Bill Clinton on Israeli-Palestinian talks, is returning to manage the fraying ties between the United States and its allies in the Persian Gulf.

headline.main: Aide’s Return to White House Reflects Changing U.S. Role in Middle East
headline.print_headline: Aide’s Return to White House Reflects Changing U.S. Role in Middle East
